intro: Dalenia sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak dalena, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a central yellowish corolla, and it produces small, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
